author: baibhavmandal
message: chore: updated tests to use specific asserts in magazine workshop steps 31-37 (#61245)

files.patch:
@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ In this case, your parent element is the `main` element. Set the content to have
 Your `main` section should have a `grid-template-columns` property set to `1fr 94rem 1fr`.
 
 ```js
-assert(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.gridTemplateColumns === '1fr 94rem 1fr');
+assert.equal(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.gridTemplateColumns, '1fr 94rem 1fr');
 ```
 
 # --seed--

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ Wrap each of your already defined values of the `grid-template-columns` property
 Your `main` selector should have a `grid-template-columns` property set to `minmax(2rem, 1fr) minmax(min-content, 94rem) minmax(2rem, 1fr)`.
 
 ```js
-assert(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.gridTemplateColumns === 'minmax(2rem, 1fr) minmax(min-content, 94rem) minmax(2rem, 1fr)');
+assert.equal(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.gridTemplateColumns, 'minmax(2rem, 1fr) minmax(min-content, 94rem) minmax(2rem, 1fr)');
 ```
 
 # --seed--

@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@ To add space between rows in the grid layout, you can use the `row-gap` property
 Your `main` selector should have a `row-gap` property of `3rem`.
 
 ```js
-assert(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.rowGap === '3rem');
+assert.equal(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('main')?.rowGap, '3rem');
 ```
 
 # --seed--

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ Set the `display` property of your `.heading` selector to `grid`.
 Your `.heading` selector should have a `display` property set to `grid`.
 
 ```js
-assert(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('.heading')?.display === 'grid');
+assert.equal(new __helpers.CSSHelp(document).getStyle('.heading')?.display, 'grid');
 ```
 
 # --seed--
